discussion.p: It's not clear what happens if a program-defined character traits type defines comparison_category as a synonym for void, or some other bogus type.
Discussion on the LWG reflector settled on making it ill-formed at the point of use.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4861.

li.p: Modify by adding a new paragraph after p3:

blockquote.p: As result of reflector discussion we decided to make a drive-by fix in p3 below.
-3- Let R denote the type traits::comparison_category if that qualified-id is valid and denotes a type ()it exists, otherwise R is weak_ordering.

p.ins: -?- Mandates: R denotes a comparison category type ().
